newsitem.title: USA: Midday NYCE cotton off on beneficial weather.
newsitem.headline: Midday NYCE cotton off on beneficial weather.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures were lower at midday, with traders focused on beneficial rains moving into the Delta and West Texas.
Players await USDA's weekly crop progress report, for release at 1600 EDT.
"Generally, the idea is that the crop conditions have improved," a trader said.
Technically, the December contract closed a gap on the charts between 74.00 and 74.26 cents a lb at the opening, but remained unable to move higher.

The failure to pierce 75.00 cents in December during last week's rally coupled with today's brisk volume amid declining prices, may suggest that further weakness is in store, said Sharon Johnson, an analyst with Frank Schneider and Co Inc.
For December, major support remained just under today's low of 74.02 cents, at 74.00 cents, followed by the contract low of 73.20 cents.
At 1150 EDT, December was down 0.43 cent at 74.15 cents.
